title: How to check whether a land is suitable for agriculture or not - Quora

response.answer_text: Here is the Checklist: Drainage condition: A well drained land or soil allows proper Oxygen supply to the roots of plants.Availability of water for Irrigation.Soil should be Alluvial or Black soil free from pebbles or limestones.Soil erosion: Land shouldn't be affected by erosion. Any stream of water or a route available for water through the land can erode the soil heavily during the rainfall.Dig upto 3 ft to 4ft. If you find Murrum (Laterite) within 3 ft or if there is a possibility of rock within 10ft, then avoid it.Approach road to the land is necessary. In case if you want to resale it, you will not face any difficulty in getting better price.Search legal documents.

Agriculture is of two types. Either we can grow crops or plant fruit trees i.e horticulture. If you want to utilise your land for crops. Then you have to get soil tested from soil testing laboratory. This service is provided free of cost to farmers by agriculture department. Soil samples are to be collected upto 9″ inches depth. Agriculture officer can guide you how to collect soil samples. For horticulture crops you need to get soil tested upto depth of 5′ . Based on soil analysis report you can judge whether soil is fit for agriculture or not.
